column3: US judge in Vegas: Evidence tainted in web gambling case - Fourth Amendment case; FBI-Caesars search case to narrow to father, son - plea deal; Judge says FBI ruse violated rights of Las Vegas hotel guest - Fourth Amendment case.
column4: "In a criminal complaint, federal authorities described him as a high-ranking member of the 14k Triad, a Chinese organized crime group. They are scheduled to ask a judge on Dec. 15 to ban the government from using against their clients’ items and statements collected during the Caesars raid. Lawyers for the Phuas filed documents this week denying U.S. prosecutors’ assertions that Paul Phua is a member or leader of the Chinese organized crime group called the 14K Triad."
column5: Paul Phua and his son Darren Wai Kit Phua faced trial on charges including operating an illegal gambling business during the World Cup soccer tournament. U.S. Magistrate Judge Peggy Leen ruled evidence the agents collected as a result of the ruse didn't justify the deception and called for evidence to be thrown out. U.S. District Judge Andrew Gordon agreed with the defense submission and ruled the FBI evidence from Caesar’s Palace inadmissible, as the basis on which it had been obtained was unconstitutional. Paul Phua walked free.
